title: This week proves the nation's love of Jane Austen is more fervent than ever
text:
Jane Austen is, as they say, having a moment. Andrew Davies’s rather excitable new series completing her fragment Sanditon has been sexing up Sunday nights on ITV. Laura Wade’s play The Watsons has adapted another of Austen’s unfinished stories, which opened in London this week to great acclaim while last month, an all-singing, all-female musical adaptation of her work received rave reviews at Bristol’s Old Vic. At this rate, it’s only a matter of time before Austen’s notes to the milkman become a ten-part Netflix special.

I’d be tempted to criticise these attempts to piggyback on the work of one of the greatest novelists of all time, were it not for two things. Firstly, this is a long and happy...
description: Jane Austen is, as they say, having a moment.
